message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. I think it's a great fit for you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $175.
Alice, thanks for the offer.  I'm interested in the product but $175 is a bit out of my budget. I'm willing to pay $100 for it. Let me know what you think.
I understand that $175 is a bit steep for you, Bob. However, I'm still willing to make a deal. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $145. It's a fair price considering its value to you.
Alice, I appreciate you coming down on the price, but $145 is still a bit high for me. I'm willing to go to $125.  This is my final offer before I consider other options.

I understand that you're trying to get the best deal, Bob. I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'll sell the product to you for $137.50. It's a fair compromise, considering the value I have in the product.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $137.50 is still more than I'm comfortable paying. I'm going to stick to my previous offer of $125. If you're not willing to accept that, I'm going to have to consider other options.
I understand that you're sticking to your guns, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession. I'll sell the product to you for $132.50. It's my final offer before I consider other options.

Alice, I appreciate you coming down to $132.50, but I'm still sticking to my final offer of $125. This is my last chance to negotiate. If you're not willing to accept it, I'll be forced to move on to other options.
I understand that you're firm on your price, Bob. I'm willing to make one last attempt to meet you in the middle. I'll sell the product to you for $130. It's my absolute final offer.
